The Dakarakkhasa Jātaka
“If, while you are being carried away,
in the waves of the ocean,
a demon, who is a human being,
would seize the boat,
after giving a gradual explanation,
you should release the Dakarakkhasa.”
“The mother should be given first,
after giving the wife, the brother,
then the friend,🔽the fifth should be given to the brahmin;
the sixth should be given to myself,
but the great medicine should not be given.”
“Your mother and your nurse,
who have had compassion for you for a long time,
are angry with you in six ways,
the wise one who sees the benefit;
after making another condition,
she has saved you from death.
That mother of yours, who gives life,
who bears you on her breast,
for what fault,
would you give her to the Dakarakkhasa?”
“The young woman wears ornaments,
and she wears a necklace;
she is a doorkeeper, a spy,
she is very busy.🔽And she sends her own messengers
to the kings of other countries,
Because of that fault,
I would give you my right hand.”
“She is the best of women,
she speaks extremely pleasantly,
She is virtuous, she follows me,
like a shadow that never leaves.
She is not angry, she is virtuous,
she is wise, she sees what is beneficial,
Because of what fault, Ubbiri,
would you give me your right hand?”
“She who is absorbed in the pleasure of play,
who has come under the sway of what is unbeneficial,
She who begs from my own sons,
begs for wealth.
I, out of love, give her
much wealth, good and bad,
Having given up what is very hard to give up,
afterwards I sorrow, depressed;
Because of that fault, Ubbiri,
I would give you my right hand.”
“By whom the country was sought out,
and the tribute brought,
Wealth that was seized from other kingdoms,
having taken it, much wealth.
The best of archers,
a hero, with sharp arrows,
Because of what fault, Ubbiri,
would you give me your right hand?”
“By whom the country was sought out,
and the tribute brought,
Wealth that was seized from other kingdoms,
and he has taken over much wealth.
He is the best of archers,
a hero with a sharp sword.
This king is happy with him,
and the boy is arrogant.
Even my service, noble lady,
is not as it was before.
Because of that fault,
I will give him my right hand.”
